briefdescription.para: parameters in the model as a member variable which enables passing the underlying data pointer to sundials for finite difference approx

detaileddescription.para:
This is the full vector of model global parameters in the order indexed in the model.
plist

briefdescription.para: scaling factors.

detaileddescription.para: Set to the values of the parameters for sensitivity. This should be identical to p as acceptible default.

briefdescription.para: which parameters to get sensitivity for as int?

detaileddescription.para: indexes parameters in p and pbar.

briefdescription.para: which parameters to get sensitivities for, as strings
a map containing model parameter names to values
number of global parameters in the model
number of parameters we want to find sensitivities for
the number of state variables in the model

detaileddescription.para: aka the size of the mStateVector

briefdescription.para: An instance of CVODEIntegrator is needed for the forward sensitivity solver.

detaileddescription.para: The ForwardSensitivitySolver is in essence a CVODEIntegrator and a SensitivitySolver. However we avoid the diamond inheritance problem that would arise from inheriting from both and the consequent need to use virtual inheritance, which may come with hidden problems;

briefdescription.para: indicator variable that specifies whether a user has manually chosen which parameters to compute sensitivities for.

detaileddescription.para: when true, the ForwardSensitivitySolver needs to update the default list of parameters to compute sensitivities for because its possible the user may modify the model between instantiation of the RoadRunner instance and solving for sensitivities.
this indicator is needed, since the test for empty whichParameter variable only works on instantiation of the FFS class
inverse of usingUseWhichParametersFromConstructor. Used for readibility in some places - helps prevent need to do mental aerobics with booleans

briefdescription.para: indicator variable which is true when the constructor that has "whichParameters" argument is used.

detaileddescription.para: This is needed for the dual control over which parameters to solve sensitivities for - construtor and main solveSensitivities method.
inverse of usingDefaultWhichParameters. Used for readibility in some places - helps prevent need to do mental aerobics with booleans

briefdescription.para: Non-linear solver for sensitivity analysis.
place to store the sensitivities
indicator for whether model has state vector variables or not
integrate the model from t0 to t0 + hstep.

detaileddescription.para:
this signature is the same as that found in Integrator().
integrating the model should update the sensitivities, which are available from getSensitivities()

briefdescription.para: instantiate the code necessary to use cvodes

inbodydescription.para: note the cvDirectDemo.c example from sundials is useful to see the different cvode options in action
Sensitivity setup Only do this if there are model variables and parameters since its possible to have an empty RoadRunner object from which we create a model using the direct interface.

briefdescription.para: free sundials memory associated with sensitivities
Get the name of this solver.

detaileddescription.para:
JKM, WBC
the caller is responsible for deleting memory associated with the returned Solver*.

briefdescription.para: resets all settings back to default values
Called whenever a new model is loaded to allow integrator to reset internal state.
Return std::string representation a la Python repr method.
Return a std::string representation of the solver.
returns a vector of global parameter names extracted from the model
get a vector of variable names in the order that they appear in the model.

detaileddescription.para: variables refers to each equation in the model and are obtained with ExecutableModel::getStateVectorId.

briefdescription.para: get global parameters as an unordered map, strings as keys and parameter values as values
return a std::vector<double> of model parameters in the order they appear in the model.
returns the indexes of parameters that user wants sensitivities for, based off of whichParameters.
retuns pointer to the state vector used by sundials for solving ODE.
retuns pointer to the state vector used by sundials for storing sensitivity matrix.
get current values of sensitivities of model variables to parameters.

parameterdescription.para: the kth derivative of the sensitivities.

memberdef.argsstring: (double start, double stop, int num, std::vector< std::string > params=std::vector< std::string >(), std::vector< std::string > species=std::vector< std::string >(), int k=0) override
memberdef.name: solveSensitivities

briefdescription.para: simulate a timeseries with sensitivities from start to step with num data points.

detaileddescription.para:
Matrix3D indexed by time. Each element of the 3D matrix is a Matrix<double> with rows and columns parameters and model variables respectively. The parameter k determines the kth order derivative of the sensitivity information that will be returned
start
starting time for time series simulation
stop
last time point for time series simulation
num
number of data points to simulate. Determines Z of Matrix3D.
params
vector of parameters that you want sensitivity for. When empty (default), compute sensitivities for all parameters vs all variables.
species
vector of species that you want sensitivity for. When empty (default), compute sensitivities for parameters vs all variables.
k
(default 0) return the kth other derivative of the sensitivity data.
for developers. Pass by value for the params is easier to wrap with swig.

inbodydescription.para: Note this is slightly contrived logic that is necessary for enabling users to supply whichParameters in the constructor and here via the params argument. This was an "accident of design" and it would be better to just have the whichParameters variable set in this method only.

briefdescription.para: set whichParameters to all model parameters in the order they appear in the model.

detaileddescription.para: whichParameters is a string vector that determines which parameters we compute sensitivities for. When user does not provide explicit parameters for sensitivities, all are used.
for developers. The whichParameters variable needs updating when a parameter is added or removed via RoadRunner::addParameter or RoadRunner::RemoveParameter.

briefdescription.para: get the parameter names that correspond to the current values of plist
get the parameter values that correspond to the current values of plist

memberdef.argsstring: (realtype time, N_Vector cv_y, N_Vector cv_ydot, void *userData)
memberdef.name: FFSDyDtFcn

briefdescription.para: Time based sensivitity solver.

detaileddescription.para: Uses CVODEIntegrator to integrate the ExecutableModel and cvodes to compute sensitivity information at each time point. Implements the TimeSeriesSensitivitySolver interface
